channel.title: World
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from World, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: ‘We wanted to take action’: US toy company fights back over Trump tariffs
item.description: Learning Resources is suing the administration, claiming the president’s tariffs are illegal – and millions of dollars are on the line The conveyors w...

item.title: CDC officials urge US flu vaccination after record child deaths last year
item.description: Americans told ‘time to get vaccinated is now’ as concerning mutation of influenza virus circulates in US Officials are urging doctors to vaccinate th...

item.title: Deadline nears for release of Epstein files – what we know so far
item.description: Justice department must release most documents by Friday, and failure to do so would provoke a firestorm In less than 48 hours, Donald Trump ’s justic...

item.title: Bank of England cuts interest rates to 3.75% in pre-Christmas boost for struggling economy
item.description: Quarter-point cut widely forecast in City following steep fall in inflation and weak economic data The Bank of England has cut interest rates by a qua...

item.title: Labour warned plan to jail fewer offenders undermines strategy to protect women and girls - UK politics live
item.description: Incoming victims’ commissioner warns government’s various strategies lack cohesion Richard Adams is the Guardian’s education editor. The British publi...

item.title: Briton who fought in Ukraine jailed for 13 years by Russia
item.description: Former British soldier Hayden Davies, labelled a mercenary by Russia, will be sent to a maximum-security prison.

item.title: How the court backlog became a huge problem - and why it's so hard to fix
item.description: The Crown Court backlog is at a record high. BBC Verify takes a look at how we got here.

item.title: Zelensky gives stark warning as EU leaders start crunch talks on Russia's frozen cash
item.description: The leaders are deciding whether to loan tens of billions of euros in frozen Russian assets to fund Ukraine's military and economic needs.

item.title: Boys to be sent on courses to tackle misogyny in schools
item.description: The measure is part of the government's strategy to tackle violence against women and girls in England.

item.title: 'Pope has one innings to save his England place'
item.description: Ollie Pope's old frailties returned in Adelaide and his wretched dismissal leaves him with one innings to save his England place, writes Matthew Henry...
